intro: Centaurea × ceballosii nothosubsp. ceballosii, commonly known as the Ceballos' centaury, is a hybrid plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
